translations.translation: We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice
So We ransomed him for a great sacrifice,
And We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,
We ransomed his son with a great sacrifice
And We rescued him in exchange of a great sacrifice. (The sacrifice of Ibrahim and Ismail – peace be upon them – is commemorated every year on 10, 11 and 12 Zil Haj).
And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice;
And We ransomed him with a Feat sacrifice.
And We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,
Then We ransomed him with a tremendous victim.
We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,
And We ransomed him with a mighty victim.
Then We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,
And We ransomed him with a momentous sacrifice:
And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice (i.e. a ram);
So, We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,
And We redeemed him with a great sacrifice.
And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,

[37:107] Then We ransomed him, the one whom he had been commanded to sacrifice, namely, Ishmael or Isaac — two different opinions — with a mighty sacrifice, [a mighty] ram from Paradise, the same one that Abel had offered as as sacrifice: Gabriel, peace be upon him, brought it and the lord Abraham sacrificed it as he cried, Allāhu akbar, ‘God is Great’.
(Then We ransomed him with a tremendous victim) We ransomed him with a fat ram.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { وَفَدَيْنَاهُ بِذِبْحٍ عَظِيمٍ } فالذَّبحُ: المَذبُوحُ
 والذَّبحُ: الفِعلُ
 والعَظيمُ: المُتقبلُ

translations.translation:
And His saying, "We sent him with a great sacrifice." The sacrifice is the one who is killed.


And the sacrifice: the act


And the great one: the receiver
